name: Premier Inn Heathrow Airport - Bath Road

reviews.text: We stayed here on the logoland package arriving on a very early international flight. The staff were very accomodating in giving us a early check in but they seemed very undertrained and inexperienced it took 3 visits to reception to get the details correct on our check in ( 2 nights instead of 1, inc. parking etc). The rooms were what you expect from a budget hotel , but were clean & security of the rooms & carpark was good which is needed as there is a lot of pedestrian traffic in & out of the hotel. Regarding the restaurant breakfast was fine & good value with kids eating for free, but the evening food was prettty awful & not cheap.There was also food offered at the bar which we didn't try. We would stay again because of the price but this is no better or worse than what you would expect from a budget hotel....
reviews.title: not bad rooms don't eat in the evening

reviews.text: We stayed here a total of 3 nights and enjoyed it. Don't be turned off by the looks of the outside, the inside of the hotel is very nice. We stayed in many Premier Travel Inns during our 2 weeks in England, Wales and Scotland and this was the nicest. It was also the only one with A/C (required due to proximitey to the airport). Also, the WIFI charge of 10GBP per 24 hr was the cheapest we had at PTI's in UK (range 10 to 17).
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a hoppa bus to the airport for 4 GBP per person. A direct phoneline to a taxi service is adjacent to the fron desk. The taxi arrived within 5 minutes, 15 GBP for 3 to terminal 3.
reviews.title: Great for an early flight

reviews.text: We enjoyed the buffet dinner our first night, but were disappointed with it 2 weeks later. I do think it is greatly overpriced at 17 GBP per person. They have the usual PTI menu, so there are many good alternatives.
reviews.title: Recommend this for any traveller!!

likes.liked: — convenient, clean, priced right, and located right where we needed it (next to airport)

reviews.text: We often stay here if we have an early(ish) flight, to make our arrival at Heathrow less stressful.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly atmosphere and helpfulness of staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights whilst working close to the airport and had a great time. It is well appointed, clean and has some really thoughtful touches like a set of lockers in the foyer to charge your phone in (handy as I had forgotten my charger), a shop and plenty of vending machines. The real magic of this place is the staff. Unfailingly courteous and friendly - every one of them. This is possibly the best ever experience of hotel staff - many thanks. Oh and this is the second visit, so I am a real convert!
reviews.title: Best Heathrow hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there May 9th, 2008. The location is very convenient to Heathrow. The Hotel Hoppa #12 drops you off at one of the entrances; the cost is 4 lbs. per person. The shuttle starts up at 4:19 am in the morning and picks up in 20-30 min. intervals.
reviews.title: Good, convenient location- Perfect for a layover.

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and good size. I was on a ground floor room. I did not hear any airplane noise. I did hear the people above, but it wasn't terrible.
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

likes.disliked: — Didn't seem to make any effort to give me the room type I wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very child friendly, they have an indoor playground for the kids to play on, so it can get a little noisy. The noise I heard in my room probably was a small child jumping around.
reviews.title: Good hotel for trip back to states from Heathrow.

likes.disliked: — lobby noise and location of computers next to children's indoor play area.

reviews.text: There are many dining & eating choices. There is a restaurant, coffee bar, pub/deli with varying costs. There is no ice machine, but the bartender was more than hospitable in giving me ice for the room. A slight drawback if you can call it that is that the bathroom door automatically closes so that when showering it does not set the smoke alarm off.
reviews.title: Thank you!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness,Food and great value for money.
likes.disliked: — Check - in was hectic and busy.

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights -easy automated check-in, clean, airy atrium on arrival. Booked twin room-had two very comfortable double beds in room-bonus! Clean room & bathroom-large white bath sheets. Ate in hotel restaurant (Thyme) both evenings-lovely food & pleasant staff. Went to Twickenham for match on bus-bus stop just along road-not too much hassle at all-will definately use Premiere Inn again
reviews.title: Fantastic quality at affordable prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after travelling from Manchester Airport to Heathrow for a connecting flight the next morning. Easy to get to from the airport on the shuttle service, everything was brilliant Had a lovely meal in the restaurant and drink in the bar, and a good sleep. Was very pleased with the prices - an excellent start to the holiday
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to Heathrow airport

reviews.text: Clean, polite staff, comfortable room, everything you could wish for even air con on the one heat wave day that we have in the uk.... Minutes from the airport. Would highly recommend? Did not hear one aircraft at all. Resturant vending machines. Fantastic king size bed. They even have descent size mug to make a brew with. Excellent all round.
reviews.title: Really nice surprise

reviews.text: With an early flight out of Heathrow Airport, I decided to take the Tube from Kings Cross station, where I had arrived by train, and stay near the airport. I took the hotel hop (₤4.50 from airport), about 15 minute ride to hotel. Large, clean room with bath. Nice restaurant, bar, and Costa Brava Coffe cafe in the lobby. The hotel hop starts running at about 6am so no problem in getting to the airport for my flight. My room was right above the lobby but it was so sound-proofed I heard no noise. A great night's sleep. I liked that I didn't have to leave the hotel. It had everything I needed, including a good dinner at the Thyme restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: The service in the restaurent was exelant especiatly Manjinda who could not do enough for you.
reviews.title: Service

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night only as part of a Park & Go package prior to an early US flight
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was a bit chaotic, but staff were polite and helpful in every way
reviews.title: Excellent Premier Travel Inn

reviews.text: Plenty of dining choices, although being August, the place was buzzing
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was on the ground floor but very adequately sound-proofed so that any outside noise was minimal
reviews.title: What a surprise

reviews.text: Room decor was basic but the bed was comfortable and both room and facilities very clean
reviews.title: Still great 3rd time around!

likes.disliked: — Close to airport but few very local amenities and busy road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Liked -
reviews.title: Service was Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large, clean and had a very comfortable queen bed.
reviews.title: Nice experience
Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our package and was excellent - great selection and staff were attentive at breakfast time.
Hotel was clean and spacious and was excellent for a airport hotel.
reviews.title: A very good hotel airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located near Heathrow Airport on Bath Road which is the major road near the north boundary of the airport.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel With A Great Airport Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the rooms nicely furnished. The bed was clean and comfortable and the linens of good quality. Check in and check out was fast and the clerk was friendly.
reviews.title: Delightful surprise!

likes.liked: — Buffet, clean comfortable room, location by Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower in the room was great and the water hot. Although there was some noise from the airport, the rooms are fairly soundproof and noise was not a problem.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel near Heathrow

likes.liked: — Quality of facilities for the price

reviews.text: We went directly to our room and didn't leave until the next morning so we can't comment on the restaurant and other facilities.
reviews.title: Overall good Hotel, but expect some downsides

reviews.text: We had to take our own bags to the room as there didn't appear to be any bell boys or the like. It was actually pleasant not to have someone with their hand out for a tip after three minutes work.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night prior to flying from heathrow as the deal with 2 weeks parking was cheaper than just parking alone! Not your typical premier inn - it's huge! massive "atrium" running through the middle with sofas and big bat one side and restaraunt the other. The meal deal they do is excellent value £22 for 3 course evening meal + drink and an all you can eat brekkie the next day. Smooth check in, nice modern comfy clean room, what more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for the night before a flight rather than working my way back down to Heathrow from Birmingham in the early morning hours. It is very near to the airport and has a shuttle bus service that picks up at the hotel. There is an on-site restaurant that is very good, and there is also a bar with decent wines. The rooms are very nice and have everything you need. You can't beat the value. The prices they charge are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location, service, and value

reviews.text: We stayed here when we came to cheer on a friend in the London Marathon. Ok it is a bit of a trek in & out of the centre of London but it was at least half the price if not less compared to central London hotels for that weekend. Also London has an excellent, affordable transport system so it wasn't so bad. The room was set up with a double & 2 singles but still had plenty of space. Although our window actually was internal & overlooked the hotel bar the room was still quiet. From the corridor next to the room it was possible to watch the planes taking off & landing at Heathrow. This fascinated the kids & again there was not excessive noise.
reviews.title: Much cheaper than Central London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast which was okay, but excellent value as kids under 16 ate free ( & my kids can eat!)
reviews.title: Quality hotel in good location relative to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely consider this Hotel again if could get it at its cheap rate.
reviews.title: Faultless Premier Inn

reviews.text: This hotel is very modern and the rooms are well appointed and large by British/European standards. The public areas are large and comfortable, the fixtures are new and there are 2 bars, a restaurant,
reviews.title: A Modern Hotel At A Good Price

likes.liked: — A modern hotel with new, clean and large rooms and large public areas, 2 bars open to 1am
likes.disliked: — If you have to be in central London everyday, this is not the ideal place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and a 24 hour coffee shop that serves light snacks. There is internet
reviews.title: Faultytowers

reviews.text: wifi in the rooms or a public terminal in the lobby. There is air conditioning in every room, which is not all that usual in the UK/Europe. You could not complain a bit about the physical facilities
reviews.title: family unfriendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: of the hotel. The service from the staff was unobtrussive and business-like; they were able to address my needs adequately but perhaps were not going out of their way to make sure every little thing was perfect. The one main thing to consider about this hotel is location. If you've never been to London before and are visiting as a tourist, this is probably not the place for you. To get to the central tourist areas requires a bus ride to a tube station, then a further 15 stop tube ride or so before you're in central London. This only costs about $5 pounds, but you'll spend a lot of time commuting if you're real goal is in the middle of London - at least 2 or 3 hours a day. On the other hand, if you have a flight the next day or business at the airport or in the Houslow area; this hotel is ideal. For the price this hotel can not be beat, and almost no hotel in central London is this new. But, if central London is where you need to be because of tourist interest or business, it is probably better to spend more money and stay somewhere more central.
reviews.title: O K For One Night

reviews.text: We booked online in January at a cost of £80. quoted. On arrival they tried to charge us extra £5. Bathroom floor all ridged. No phone. No table. No shampoo /wash in dispenser. No coffee and worst of all no towels. We had early flight so I had to go to reception at 4am to beg towels- was asked why I didn't use my phone- what phone ? We had a meal in evening, could have re-soled my shoes with it. did not pay for it as I sent it back. I have written to the Manager with my complaints but no reply to date. Never again
reviews.title: Great and cheap hotel at Heathrow

reviews.text: Stayed one night as a layover. Yes, it was a bit pricey (at about 160 USD for a single), but have you SEEN the prices of Heathrow hotels? They're all very expensive, and this hotel gives you plenty, is clean and comfortable, plus the place fits the bill perfectly for a layover. Took the hoppa bus, and the total travel time was something like fifteen minutes, very convenient. The hotel is clean and well-maintained. Lots of staff downstairs, all friendly and helpful. Bar with food, as well as a full-service restaurant and a coffee bar with sandwiches, pastries, etc. Pretty huge selection of eating options, actually. Free copies of The Independent in the lobby. My room looked directly onto one of the runways, with planes landing not 100 yards away...But NO noise. So, lots of fun for plane-watching (if you're into that sort of thing), but without any problems. Wireless internet available for 3 pounds per two hours, which isn't too bad. In all, I couldn't find any faults, and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Heathrow Layover Hotel

likes.liked: — A reputable hotel, convenient to LHR
likes.disliked: — pricey, both for room and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews about this hotel. It is exactly what you want and expect of a Premire Travel Inn only bigger and with more facilities. Everything was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good hotel, a problem with their parking package though

reviews.text: I just wanted to mention a problem we had with their park and fly package. When you book this package your car stays with Q-Park which is actually next door. It seems that there is some kind of break down in communication between the hotel and Q-Park which meant that Q-Park were not expecting us and tried to make us pay again when we left.
reviews.title: Absolutely what you should get for the money.

reviews.text: When we arrived for the parking we gave the receptionist at Q-Park our booking confirmation and she took the details down and we thought that was that. However, when we arrived home after our holiday they still didn't have a record of our booking or the fact that we'd already paid. The same receptionist that checked us in asked to see our booking confirmation again which I no longer had. This caused a problem and we had to argue with the lady until she'd give us our car keys back. We still had to give her our contact details so she could check that we were telling the truth. The whole thing was a bit annoying to say the least.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I still think the park and fly package is worth booking as it is good value but I'd call Q-Park before you arrive to check the hotel has confirmed your booking and keep your booking confirmation until you get back after your trip!
reviews.title: Fabulous

likes.disliked: — lack of staff on front desk

reviews.text: The Best Premier Inn I have stayed in. The room product is fabulous and the staff are great.
reviews.title: Best Premier Inn

reviews.text: It is a big hotel with a good bar and restaurant, so there's a good atmosphere inside the place. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying at Heathrow. However make sure you get the "Bath Road" Premier in as there are two Premier Inn's at Heathrow.
reviews.title: good base for zzzzzz's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent
reviews.title: Incorrect Location on Google Maps!

reviews.text: if you have an early start. This location is perfectly adequate with half hour free wifi and 24 hours £3. You can have a bath too! I have read others found it noisy and double booked. I am a light sleeper, no probs here. Grab a hot supper. Relaxing lounge area, pub type garden benches for fresh air of an evening.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware- this hotel is not at the location it appears on Google Maps. There are two Premier Inns at Heathrow on Bath Road. Be sure you know which you are staying at. We had dropped off our luggage at the wrong Premier Inn, then received no help in getting to the other which is 3 miles away. We had to pay for a ₤15 taxi ride to go to the other inn and ₤15 to return as we arrived late from London and the buses were no longer running. This was happening to a lot of people and taxi drivers said this happens everyday. Very frustrating and made this not a very "great deal."
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

reviews.text: Check in was slow due to having four rooms booked but people booking one room seemed to go through quickly. The rooms are adequate, clean and comfortable. Dinner was satisfactory - some meals being better than others. My partner and I had steak which was very tough. Other members of the group had scampi and curry both were of good standard. There was a problem with the cooker which delayed our meal but the staff were very apologetic and helpful and the problem resolved within an hour breakfast is self service at which you help yourself to a good selection of food. The rooms are amazingly quiet considering you are next to a very busy road and the airport Check out was simple. The hopper bus costs £4.50 pp and runs frequently from early to late. It stops at the hotel doors and took 10mins at 8.45am to heathrow terminal 3. An easy and adequate hotel. The good thing with premier inn is that they are all of a very similar standard so you know what to expect.
reviews.title: An easy mid range place to stay pre flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights while winding down our trip to the UK. The room was ready even though we arrived early. The room was spacious, very clean and very sound proofed. Right next to the runway 5 and we couldn't hear any outside noise. Bus 423 stops right in front of the hotel and will take you to the airport saving about $6.pp each way. Exiting terminal 5, there are two lanes for buses. if you go to stand 7 in the first lane, you can catch bus 423. Wish we had know this fact, it would have saved us $25.00 over using the Hoppa bus which is located in the second lane from the building. Also, the restaurant is very good with better prices than you would expect in a hotel setting. When you need to print your boarding pass, tell the front desk and they will give you a voucher so that use of the computer will be free. Friendly helpful staff, a good nights sleep and convenient without costing an arm and a a leg. Great value!!!
reviews.title: This is the ONE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had spent a couple of weeks at some really lovely hotels before we checked into The Premier Inn at 15 Bath Road Heathrow. We decided to stay there to avoid last minute problems leaving London to catch our AM flight. I expected a small, drab room and minimal services. The Premier Inn was a pleasant surprise. The place ran like a well oiled machine, making the check-in to check out process smooth and glitch free - something REALLY important when you're catching an international flight. Our room was clean and spacious. It offered a free hour of WIFI and then you could buy 24 hours for a very nominal fee. The restaurant's food was unremarkable, but the menu was varied and service was good.
reviews.title: Ran Like A Well Oiled Machine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a converter plug which the hotel happily loaned to us. When it didn't work properly they sent someone to our room instantly to fix it. We had trouble turning on the heat and they sent up a space heater at once (turned out not to be necessary - we had misread the directions on thermostat).
reviews.title: Great hotel and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong - this isn't a luxury hotel. It is an airport hotel that offered luxury hotel efficiency and service. It was clean and comfortable. The staff are experienced and helpful. I recommend it highly to travelers who want to be near to Heathrow.
reviews.title: Quick stop in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put up at the Premier Inn at Bath Road courtesy of British Airways due to missing a connecting flight to Brussels.
reviews.title: Utter Rubbish

reviews.text: We waited over an hour for the shuttle bus to arrive to take us to the hotel.
reviews.title: very impressed with premier

reviews.text: We had 'vouchers' for two rooms (the guy at BA had got confused and thought we were travelling alone) and we were given rooms on different floors. We decided that we would choose the best room and were delighted that the mistake had taken place because one of the rooms was a smoking room and reaked of tobacco smoke.
reviews.title: Cheap and handy for Heathrow. Is what it is.

reviews.text: The room was small and very stuffy. We turned the air conditioning on and though it was on full it did nothing to cool the air. Infact the air conditioning was so noisy that it sounded like a tumble drier full of stones going round and round.
reviews.title: Beat my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet was disgusting. I wouldn't have fed what was on offer to my dog; let alone anyone else.
reviews.title: Good for the night before a flight

aka: Premier Inn Heathrow Airport (Bath Road) Hotel Hounslow
description: Creating a new dining experience in a relaxing environment, the Thyme restaurant and bar provide a range of ‘tasty’ dishes serving both lunch and dinner options. Along with a COSTA coffee store open 24 hours a day and our welcoming hotel bar area you will never be short of food and drink options. Not to mention our ‘All You Can Eat’ Full English Buffet Breakfast at only £8.25 per person. At Premier Inn we pride ourselves on comfort and quality. That's why each of our 590 bedrooms has a king sized bed, en-suite bathroom, safety deposit box, tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, freeview TV and wifi (at an additional cost). An ideal choice for a business stay, our hotel is conveniently located with great transport links to Heathrow Airport and Central London. Our brand new business lounge offers you the chance to catch up, whilst our 18 meeting rooms provide a great environment to have your business meetings. For leisure guests, we are ideally located for Heathrow Airport with ample car parking onsite (£10 per night). We also offer a range of park and fly options (please contact hotel direct to arrange this). We are serviced by the Hoppa to the Terminals, operating from 0424 until 2324 (Terminals 1 and 3) and 0415 to 2345 (Terminals 4 and 5) at a cost of £4.50 per person or £8 return. Furthermore we are just 15 miles from both Windsor Castle and Legoland Windsor. Central London is easily accessible by the London Underground stations and the Heathrow Express. With Children (up to the age of 15) eating a free breakfast when accompanied by a full paying adult and no additional charges for family rooms, we are the top choice for families.
